QuantX Biosciences is an emerging computation and AI-powered small molecule drugdiscovery company based in Princeton, New Jersey. QuantX has raised a substantial Series Around led by OrbiMed and Creacion Ventures. QuantX aims to build a world-classcomputational drug discovery platform by merging physics-based modeling and modernAI/machine learning technologies, while fully utilizing an industry-leading high-performance computing resource. With a team of highly accomplished drug hunters,empowered and tightly integrated by the platform, we strive to discover breakthroughmedicines. We are seeking an experienced and accomplished computational chemist to join our growing team. Responsibilities:
● Apply state-of-the-art computation-powered drug design techniques to design and optimize candidate molecules to achieve desired potency and properties, in close collaboration with our medicinal chemistry colleagues.● Contribute to the identification, evaluation, and implementation of innovative computational approaches that improve research productivity and success, in close collaboration with our technology development colleagues.● Manage or mentor junior team members. Qualifications:
● PhD in Computational Chemistry or related fields, with three or more publications● Significant accomplishments and demonstrated creativity in small molecule drug designs with a minimum of 5 years’ industrial experience● Understanding of computational chemistry principles and their application within a multidisciplinary drug discovery environment● Broad experience in a variety of computational chemistry methods, including molecular dynamics, quantum chemistry, protein modeling, etc.● Working knowledge of physical and organic chemistry, retrosynthetic design, physical chemical properties, biological assays, and PKDM properties● Proficiency in scientific scripting and programming languages, preferably Python● Familiarity with standard modeling software ● A successful candidate will have strong communication skills and an enabling attitude, be a problem solver, and have the desire to work in a collaborative manner in a team environment
This will be a remote home-based position that will require some non-standard working hours including early morning or late evening teleconferences to support global company programs. Quarterly travel will be required for team meetings.Our team offers competitive compensation, including salary, benefits, and long-term equity incentives. The actual job title and salary will be commensurate with experience and responsibilities.
QuantX is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
